snippet: The 17-story-tall white-tiled mausoleum being built to hold the remains of Simón Bolívar looks to many people here like, among other things, the world’s biggest skateboard ramp.
abstract: Caracas Journal; many residents in Caracas, Venezuela, find that the 17-story-tall white-tiled mausoleum being built to hold the remains of the national hero Simon Bolivar reminds them of the world’s biggest skateboard ramp, shopping mall or sailing ship; but to its creators, it is an eloquent tribute to the father of the nation.
lead_paragraph: The 17-story-tall white-tiled mausoleum being built to hold the remains of Simón Bolívar looks to many people here like, among other things, the world’s biggest skateboard ramp.

headline.seo: In Venezuela, a Colossal New Resting Place for Bolívar
headline.main: Ramp? Mall? Ship? No, a Titan’s New Tomb
headline.print_headline: Ramp? Mall? Ship? No, a Titan’s New Tomb
